optcom.utils.utilities_helpers package¶

Submodules¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.array_equal_duo_map(array_ref, array_new)¶

Return an indices map for the first and second array where the first provided array is equal to the second provided array. Process the arrays row wise (along first dimension). Assume that both arrays contains unique elements.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.array_equal_map(array_ref, array_new)¶

Return an indices map for the second array where the first provided array is equal to the second provided array. Process the arrays row wise (along first dimension). Assume that both arrays contains unique elements.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.auto_pad(x_data, y_data, value_left=0.0, value_right=0.0)¶

Pad x_data according to y_data. x_data and y_data must have same dimension and space between elemens of y_data or x_data must be equal. The padding on left is fill with value_left as well as the padding on the right with value_right.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.combine_to_one_array(x_data)¶

Combine a multidimension to one array respecting spacing in original array. Original arrays must have same spacing between elements.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.hstack_like(ndarray, ndarray_ref)¶

Stack horizontally the array ndarray depending on length of ndarray_ref.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.hstack_ndarray(ndarray, length)¶

Stack horizontally the array ndarray length times.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.modify_length_ndarray(ndarray, length)¶

Modify the length of the array ndarray according to the provided length.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.pad_array_with_last_elem(x, y, sym=False)¶

Pad a numpy ndarray x with the last elemen according to array y.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.array_helpers.vstack_ndarray(ndarray, length)¶

Stack vertically the array ndarray length times.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.attr_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.attr_helpers.check_attr_range(attr, attr_name, min_attr, max_attr, strict_left=False, strict_right=False)¶

Check if the provided attribute is in the range provided.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.attr_helpers.check_attr_type(attr, attr_name, *types)¶

Check if the provided attribute is of the provided type.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.attr_helpers.check_attr_value(attr, attr_values, attr_default)¶

Check if the provided attribute is one of the allowed values provided. If not, return a provided default value.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.component_helpers module¶

exception optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.component_helpers.DimensionError¶

Bases: Exception

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.component_helpers.pulse_positions_in_time_window(nbr_channels, rep_freq, time_window, position)¶

Return the relative position of the pulses in the considered time window depending on the specified absolute positions and repetition frequencies.

Parameters

  • nbr_channels -- The number of channels.

  • rep_freq -- The repetion frequency of each channel. \([THz]\)

  • time_window -- The time window. \([ps]\)

  • position -- The position in the time window for each channel.

Returns

The relative positions of the channels in the provided time window depending on the repetion frequencies.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.data_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.data_helpers.deriv(fct, x, order_deriv=0)¶

Compute the n^{th} derivative of the function fct.

Parameters

  • fct -- Function to call to calculate derivatives.

  • x -- The parameters.

  • order_deriv -- The order of the derivative. (0 <= order <= 5)

Returns

The derivative of the function fct.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.data_helpers.fit_data(x, y, fill_down=0.0, fill_up=0.0, extrapolate=False)¶

Return a callable object which extrapolate the data x and y. For more, see documentation of scipy.interpolate.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.data_helpers.read_csv(file_name, delimiter=',')¶

Read a csv file. Evaluate empty cell to zero.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.data_helpers.write_csv(data, names, file_name, delimiter=',')¶

Write data as a csv file file_name.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.equalize_len_list_elem(x, elem=None)¶

Make all elements of a list of same length and pad the elements needed according to the longest element if elem is None, with the value of elem otherwise.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.get_max_len_list(x)¶

Return the longest list and its index in a list of list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.is_all_elem_list_identical(x)¶

Return True if all elemens of a list are identical, else False.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.is_float_in_list(var, list)¶

Return True if the float var is in list list and avoid rounding errors.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.list_repetition_bool_map(x, highlight_first_elem=True)¶

Return a bool list of same dimension as the input list where the repeated element are set to False, else True.

Parameters

  • x -- List to consider.

  • highlight_first_elem -- If True, set to True the first occurrence of a repeated element, else set to True the last occurence of a repeated element.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.list_repetition_indices(x)¶

Return a list with repeated elements index in the initial list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.lower_str_list(x)¶

Lower all elements of a list of string.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.make_list(x, length=1, elem=None)¶

Make a list of length length out of x by padding x with last element of x if elem is None, elem otherwise. If x is None, return a list of length length where each element is None.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.make_matrix(x, nbr_lin=1, nbr_col=1, elem=None, sym=False)¶

Make a matrix nbr_lin times nbr_col out of x. Make a symmetric matrix if sym is True, pad with last element otherwise where the last element is the last element of x if elem is None, elem otherwise.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.make_tensor(x, nbr_lin, nbr_col, depth=0, elem=None)¶

Make a tensor out of x and pad with elem if not None, with last item otherwise. Tensor size is nbr_lin imes nbr_col imes depth.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.mean_list(x)¶

Return the mean of a list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.pad_list_with_last_elem(x, y, sym=False)¶

Pad list x with its last elem according of y list length. If sym is True, then pad also y depending on x.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.pad_with_last_elem(x, length, elem=None)¶

Pad list x up to length with its last element if elem is None, with elem otherwise.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.permutations(x)¶

Return all possible permutations of a list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.sum_elem_list(x)¶

Sum all the elements of a list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.unique(x)¶

Return a list with no repeated elements from a provided list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.list_helpers.unique_list(x)¶

Return a list with no repeated elemens from a provided list as well as a list with repeated elements index in the initial list.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.physics_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.physics_helpers.db_to_linear(db, ref=None)¶

Convert from decibel to linear form.

Parameters

  • db -- The decibel values to convert. \([dB]\)

  • ref -- A value by which to multiply the result.

Returns

The converted linear form. \([]\)

Notes

\[P_{lin} = 10^{\frac{P_{dB}}{10}}*P_0\]
optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.physics_helpers.linear_to_db(linear, ref=None)¶

Convert from linear form to decibel.

Parameters

  • linear -- The linear form values to convert. \([]\)

  • ref -- A value by which to divide the provided linear values.

Returns

The converted decibel form. \([dB]\)

Notes

\[P_{db} = 10log_{10}\Big(\frac{P_{lin}}{P_0}\Big)\]

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.terminal_display_helpers module¶

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.terminal_display_helpers.print_terminal(to_print=None, sep_type='-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n')¶

Print a string on the terminal.

optcom.utils.utilities_helpers.terminal_display_helpers.warning_terminal(to_print, sep_type='-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n')¶

Print a warning on the terminal.
